thread.title: Woolworths turns to cheap beer in deli and meat fight
thread.title_full: Woolworths turns to cheap beer in deli and meat fight

author: Patrick Hatch
title: Woolworths turns to cheap beer in deli and meat fight
text:
The deli is a vital battleground for Coles and Woolworths.
Woolworths has turned to the enduring appeal of cheap beer in an effort to boost stagnating sales at its delicatessen and meat counter.
Under a week-long deal ending on Tuesday, a receipt for any seafood, fresh meat or deli item entitles shoppers to $10 six packs of Heineken or Hahn Super Dry at Woolworths-owned BWS bottle shops, or a $10 discount on cartons of the same beers.
The deal lets savvy bargain hunters buy a single ham slice for less than a dollar and then score two six packs for $20 at BWS - a saving of $18 - and signals that Woolworths is trying to regain lost ground in the important deli market.
Can cheap beer help restore Woolworths' share of the deli market? Photo: Gabriele Charotte
While Woolworths remains the biggest player in deli sales, which are worth $4.7 billion annually, it has been losing ground to rival Coles.
Advertisement A Roy Morgan report released this month estimated Woolworths' share of total deli sales fell slightly from 44.1 per cent in 2011 to 43 per cent in 2015.
Meanwhile, Coles' claim surged from 31.5 per of the market to 36.7 per cent over the same period.
Retail analysts consider deli sales to be a vital battleground for the two supermarket giants as they drive greater sales across whole stores while being immune to competition from discount players like Aldi, which does not have a deli counter.
Woolworths has had a tumultuous year, suffering a plunging share price, two profit downgrades, the resignation of its chief executive , poor food and grocery sales and continued pressure on its board .
BWS – Australia's largest liquor retailer with more than 1200 stores across the country – along with Woolworths' Dan Murphy's and The Wine Quarter had combined sales of $7.4 billion in the 2014 financial year, Woolworths' last financial report shows.
